elementText.text:
Receipt for silver: A receives in payment from B on behalf of C the silver of the ṭīpu-payment (additional payment?) of the bow-obligation (ṭīpu ša qašti) from the end of Simānu (III) of the 3rd year of Darius till the end of Simānu (III) of the 6th year. C is to bring the earlier receipts (giṭṭu) to show them to A. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-nāṣir//Miṣirāya).
 
A = Rēmūtu/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Atkuppu; B = Ina-Esagil-zēri/Nergal-uballiṭ//Sagdidi; C = Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Marduku

elementText.text:

A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fC = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī (slave of B); D = Nabû-zēru-iqīša

elementText.text:
Receipt for dates: B owes A 8;2 kor of dates with interest. A receives them and their interest according to B’s promissory note (uˀiltu). A clause against further promissory notes against B follows. A is to hand over the promissory note on the 2nd day of month [x] to B. 7 witnesses (1 witness added on the edge), and [the scribe] (Ea-iddin/Na[bû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa).
 
A = Nergal-nāṣir/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Pahāru; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates (damaged): B owes [x kor of dates of the field of fA which she shares with C1] and fC2. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor a load (of palm-frond ribs), 15 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date-palm hearts (liblibbu), date-palm fibres (mangagu), date baskets (gipû) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). B is paid the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu, gugallūtu). 6(?) witnesses, remainder of rev. lost.
 
[fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi]; B = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; [C1 = Nabû-tabni-uṣur (brother of fA)(?)]; fC2 = fTabluṭu/Iddin-Nabû (daughter of fA)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates: B owes to A 2;1 kor of dates, 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu), 1 container of pressed dates (darīku), the remainder of yield of the plot (ebūr eqli)  from the 11th year of Darius. He is to pay it in Arahsamnu (VIII) in [Babyl]on. B is paid the dates of corvée labour (dullu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). A damaged passage follows concerning the witnessing of an illegible act in the 12th year of Darius and the statement against having cut [(something) ...] and that evidence thereof will be provided. [beginning of rev. lost] 2 witnesses extant and the scribe (Nabû-mukīn-apli//Šangû-Nergal).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu

elementText.text:
Plan of uban plot (damaged): The obverse speaks about measurements (mišhatu, meš-ha-at) of a plot of land near the Zababa Gate. A is mentioned. 2 2/3 shekels of silver are the price of excess sq. r. The reverse gives the ground plan of the plot with the south end, i.e. the right side of the tablet, damaged. The north end, whose upper side measures 15 ⌈5/6⌉(?) ammatu, borders on the house of B1; the western end, whose lower side measures ⌈16 2/3⌉(?) ammatu, borders on the house of B2; and the eastern end, whose upper side measures 16 ammatu, borders on a narrow through-street (sūqu qaṭnu āṣû). The total area amounts to 5;0.1.(13 ½) sq.r (ca. 64 m²) (possibly connected to BM92796 and VAT384).
 
A = [...]/Kurbanni-Marduk//[...]; B1 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur; B2 = [...]/[...]

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver: B owes A ½ mina of white silver and has given his house as security. A receives the money from C who has bought said house (cf. BM77513). A was present as a witness at the drawing up of the purchase tablet (A is not in the witness list of BM77513, but the first witness [Bēl-iddin/Nādin-ahi//Maštuk] and the scribe are). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Mušallim-Marduk/Šūzubu//Kānik-bābi).
 
A = Nabû-šumu-līšir/Zēru-ukīn//Ēṭiru; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B owes to A 1 minas 3 shekels of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina (20%), which will commence with the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 28th year (of Darius) (scil. the following month). B’s prebend in the temple of Išhara is the security of A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-asûa/[Iddin-Nabû]//Atkuppu).
 
A = Ana-Bēl-upāqu/Šamaš-erība//Munnabittu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Dialogue document regarding the adoption of a grandson with bequest: A approaches B1 and fB2 with the request to adopt C, their 3-year-old son. They grant the request (šemû, iš-še-[mu-ú⌉) to A and give him C for adoption (ana mārûti). A makes over to C prebendary income, viz., the heads of purified sheep (immeru ubbubu), [the epigastrium? (karšu)], the allotment (isihtu) of sheep, [... ...] for the whole year, all that is before [Papsukkal] of Bīt-Bēlet-Eanna by the canal of Ešasurra before Išhara, and 1.1.4 kor planted and arable field, which is on the iltuk of the riv[er?] next to the property of Bēl-iddin//Arad-[Bēl/Nabû] and next to the nār-Kaldu, next to the Harru-ša-Ninurta. 5 witnesses “are present at the sealing”, and the scribe (Bāniya/Sūqāya//Bēl-eṭēri).
 
A = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Nergal-uballiṭ//Bēl-eṭēri; B1 = Kidin-Marduk/Iddin-Nabû//Bēl-eṭēri (son-in-law of A); fB2 = Ramûa/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-eṭēri (wife of B1; daughter of A); C = Marduk-rēmanni/Kidin-Marduk//Bēl-eṭēri (son of B1 and fB2)

elementText.text:
Lease of prebend regarding the food offerings of Išhara for two years: B will provide (nadānu) the meal (naptanu) of Išhara, which belongs to A, from the 1st of Ayyāru (II) of the 2nd year of Cyrus for 2 years. B bears the responsibility of interruption (pūt baṭli) and inspection (pūt masnaqti) of the bread and beer. In return A gives 2;3.2 kor of barley from the prebendary payment (maššartu) to B. 1 witness and the scribe (Libluṭ/Iqīšāya//Mudammiq-Adad). Addendum: A will deliver the barley in Esagil; each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Ina-qāt-Bēl-lumhur, slave of Iqīšāya

A conditional clause concerning failment to pay that is not entirely legible follows. At least 6 witnesses and [the scribe] (Erība-Marduk/[Nabû]-aplu-iddin//Rab-banê).
 
A = Nabû-uballiṭ/Nabû-[...]//Gahul; B1 = Bēl-ibni/Rēmūtu//Bābūtu; B2 = Arad-Bēl/Gūzānu//Tunāya; B3 = Bēl-ibni/Nabû-uṣuršu//Tunāya; B3 = Hašdāya/[Mušallim//Bābū]tu; B4 = Šellebu[/Bazūzu//]Bābūtu; B5 = [...]/[...]//[...]; B6 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

He is to pay in [Arahsamnu (VIII)] in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with [...] loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and [...]. The dates are the preferential share of fA with C. At least 3 witnesses and the scribe ([...]-Marduk/[...]//Rabi-ilia) legible.

elementText.text:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA 2 kor of dates, the impost (imittu, imitti eqli) of 1 kor of land of fA’s in Kār-Tašmētu. He is to pay the entire 2 kor of dates in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI in Arahsamnu (VIII); additionally 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), 10 (loads of palm frond ribs [huṣābu]), [x] date baskets (gipû) and 2 containers of pressed dates (darīku). The guard’s fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are paid. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nergal-šarrāni//Dābibī). Addendum: the land is dowry property of fA.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī//Atkuppu

A = Erība-Marduk/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with urban land as security: B owes fA 1/3 mina 4 shekels of silver by Tašrītu (VII). The built-on and unbuilt plots of land that B shares with D1 and D2 are security for it. A clause making all earlier promissory notes in the household of fA and C invalid and the property of B follows. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Lābāši-Marduk/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu/Egibi; B = Iqīšāya-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu
C = Iddin-Nabû</Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu> (husband of fA); D1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (brother of B); D2 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu (brother of B)

elementText.text:
Purchase of house: A buys the house and hut (bītu epšu u huṣṣu) in the Šuanna district in Babylon of B (cf. for this house VAT98 and VAT67).  The price is 36.5 shekels of silver per sq. r., so A purchases the 5;0.0.10 sq. r for 3 minas 5 shekels of block silver and additional 6 shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (lu-bar-ri ša bēlet bīti); i.e. 3;11 minas of silver in total. The house comprises 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the house of C1, 2;0.1.3? sq. r (would be 2;0.2.4 according to VAT98 and VAT67) sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 2;0.1.3? sq. r (would be 2;0.1.6 according to VAT98 and VAT67) on the upper front on the north, next to the exit (mūṣû) of C1, and 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C2 and next to the sq. r of the dowry (nudunnû) of fC3; i.e. a total of 5;0.0.10 sq. r. Clauses confirming the reception of the money and excluding further litigation on part of A’s party on pain of paying the price 12 times over follow. 6 witnesses ((ina kanāk ṭuppi), 1 ina ašābi-witness (fAmat-Ninlil, wife of B, who took 8 shekels of silver as a gift), and the scribe (Libūru/Nabûnnāya [same as in VAT67]). Fingernail impressions of B are in place of a seal.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C1 = Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; C2 = Aššur-erība (AN.ŠÁR-eri-ba); fC3 = fLū-balṭāt/Nergal-ušallim//Egibi (cf. VAT98 which gives fLū-idiya/Marduk-ušallim//Egibi; and VAT67)

A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk

elementText.text:
Receipt of gift of silver: A, messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni, receives in payment (eṭēru) from C the gift  (qīštu) of (an unspecified amount of) silver of B. The tablet is sealed with a seal probably associated with the ša-muḫḫi-bīt­āni.
 
A = Šamaš-iddin/Uṣur-ilia (messenger [mār šipri] of the ša-muhhi-bītāni); B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Contract for performance of prebendary duties: The share of B1 of the prebend of B1 and B2 before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk consisting of a monthly instalment of 4 large (rabbû) takkasû-cakes is at the disposal (ina muhhi) of A. Each month A will give the cakes of the rations (kurrummatu) to B1. B1 in return will give one uzāru-cloth to A. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-nāṣir/Mudammiq-Nabû//Rab-banê).
 
A = Damqiya/Marduk-šumu-ibni/Isinnāya; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (elder brother of B1);

elementText.text:
Cancellation of promissory note: The promissory note (uˀiltu) for 2 minas of cut silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the price of muṣiptu-garment(s), that fA drew up (eˀēlu) against B, her husband, is to be broken (hepû), wherever seen, because fA did not pay B the money as stated in the promissory note (uˀiltu). The latter had been drawn up “as a statement of interest” (ana ṣibûtu). 5 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-aplu-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Pahāru).
 
fA = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Obligation to swear an oath (heavily damaged): The heavily damaged operative section seems to deal with the obligation of A to swear an oath before Muštēšir-habli (the deified weapon of Marduk) by a certain date. A clause dealing with the penalty for failing to swear the oath is added. At least 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-šumu-imbi//[...]-Bēl).
 
A = [...]/Nādin

Each party has taken a copy. 5 witnesses and [the scribe] (Erībāya/Saggilu//[...]). Addendum: B is thus clear of the entire [debt].

elementText.text:
Debt note concerning ilku (damaged): 1/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy which is a third of a bow-obligation (qaštu) till the end of Ṭebētu (X) of the 9th year of Darius and the service obligation (ilku) of B are mentioned. A1, A2 and B(?) are mentioned following the introduction of the subject of the tablet, whose roles are unclear due to the broken context. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bazūzu/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu).
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = [...]/Bēl-useppe//[Bābūtu]; B = Šūzubu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//Bābūtu

elementText.text:
Attestation of witnessing the sale of a slave: The tablet records that A was present as witness among the elders (lúab-bameš) at the drawing up of the tablet in which fD was sold to fB by fC. 4 witnesses, including the maternal uncle of fB (Iqīšāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu) and the brother of fB (Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Balāṭu//Egibi), and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya//Rab-banê (oldest son of fC); fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fC = Nūptāya/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; fD = fNanāya-bēlu-uṣrī

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates (damaged): B1 and B2 owe to fA [x amount of dates]. [They bear responsibility for] each other and [whoever] will be at hand [is to pay the debt, together with a load of] palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), [...] 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) [are not paid(?)]. At least 3 witnesses, remainder of rev. lost.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu

elementText.text:
Receipt for dates: A receives from C on behalf of fB 1;4 kor dates out of a debt owed to fB by C which amounts to 4;2.3 kor(?). These are the capital amount and interest of the harvest of fB’s field from the 23rd year. Addendum: each party has taken a copy. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Šulum-Bābili/Zababa-pirˀ-uṣur).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu; C = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal

elementText.text:
Exchange of houses: A and B exchange houses in the Šuanna district of Babylon. A’s house comprises 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the house of A, 2;0.2.4 sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the upper front on the north next to the exit (mūṣû) of C1, and 2;0.1.6 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C2 and next to a property belonging to the dowry of (nudunnû) of fC3; i.e. a total of 5;0.0.10 sq. r (cf. VAT98). B’s house comprises 3;0.3.(3+5/6) sq. r on the upper side on the west, next to the narrow no-through street (sūqu qatnu lā āṣû), the exit of the houses, 3;.0.2.8 sq. r on the lower side on the east, next to the house of C4, 3 sq. r on the upper front on the north, next to the narrow no-through street, and 3;.0.0.14 sq. r on the lower front on the south, next to the house of C5 (= total of 10;0.3.7 sq. r). Since B’s house is almost double the size of A’s, A pays 2/3;4 minas of silver per sq. r. Thus A pays 3;58 minas of block silver and additional 8 shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (<lu>-ba-ri ša bēlet bīti); i.e. 4;6 minas of silver in total. The document closes with the usual final: the money was received, further litigation on part of the party of B is excluded on pain of paying the price 12 times over, each party has taken a copy. 6 witnesses (ina kanāk ṭuppi), 1 ina ašābi-witness (fAmat-Ninlil, wife of B), and the scribe (Libūru/Nabûnnāya). Fingernail impressions of B are in place of a seal.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; B = Lābāši/Kurbanni-Marduk//Šamaš-bāri; C1 = Balāṭu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Rab-banê; C2 = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-zēru-ušabši//Atû; fC3 = fLū-idiya/Nergal-ušallim//Egibi (but cf. VAT98 which gives: fLū-idiya/Marduk(!)-ušallim//Egibi); C4 = Erībāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur; C5 = Šamaš-šumu-līšir/Nādin//Pahāru

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA1 receives (mahāru) 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy from B, which is the price of the butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, that C sold to him (as it was made known [edû Š] in BM77478+). fA1 returns to B the corresponding promissory note (uˀiltu; cf. BM77521) and the tablet concerning the dispute over the prebend with D (cf. BM77417). 10 witnesses extant; indication of scribe and dating lost.
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqiya; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = <Ana->Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; D = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for remainder of the price of a prebend: B owes to A 15 shekels of white silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the price of a prebend of A. In Nisannu (I) B is to pay up. Apart from the 15 shekels he is to also pay 4 shekels of silver to C. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur//Eppēš-ilī; C = Gula-zēru-ibni.

elementText.text:
Lease of prebendary duties: A1 leases (nadānu) to B the prebendary duties concerning takkasû-cakes each month for 17 days before Kāribu in Esagil, the temple of Marduk. The prebend belongs to A1 and A2. Each month, starting with the 1st of Addāru (XII), B will take (našû) 6 cakes from Esagil for A1. Addendum: Each has taken a copy.
 
A1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (elder brother of A1); B = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Ahiyaūtu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, the price of muṣiptu-garment(s): B owes 2 minas of white silver of 1/8 alloy without interest, which is the price of muṣiptu-garment(s), to fA. But fA will not receive the money from B for 15 years. When B receives (mahāru[?], i-di-har) the silver for fA, he will pay (nadānu, i-na-da-áš-šú) fA the capital amount without interest. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nidinti-Bēl/Līširu//Bēl-ušumgal).
 
fA = Hīptāya/Balāṭu//Rab-banê; B = Šellebu/Iddināya//Nappāhu (husband of fA; cf.  MLC1816)

elementText.text:
Contract for supply of timber: B is to deliver to A 3 good-quality beams (gušūru) at the end of Ayyāru (II) at the dam of Kār-Tašmētu. These 3 beams comprise 2 good-quality, thick (šapṣu, šepṭūtu), trimmed (gaṣṣūtu) beams of similar girth (tāpalu), 2/3 cubit in width, one of which is 10 cubits long for a gate-support(?) (bāb išdu), and the other, a middle beam (qablû) 5 cubits long, plus 1 hewn(?) (hubû) beam 8 cubits long. A is to pay B 0;1 kor of dates. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Ea-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Libluṭ/Nabû-šar-ahhēšu//Damiqu

elementText.text:
Obligation to produce a witness to a transaction: A1 and A2 are to have B preside (ašābu Š) as witness (mukinnûtu) to fD’s purchase document (uˀiltu) of fC, as B raises claim (ana paqāri alāku) with E over fC (cf. VAT93). A clause in case of non-compliance on pain of paying 1 mina 12 shekels of silver and 1 kor of barley follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Libūru/Nabû-zēru-līšir//Nabûnnāya).
 
A1 = Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; A2 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya/Rab-banê; B = Iddin-Nabû/Šulāya/Rab-banê; fC = fNanāya-bēl-uṣrī (slave of fD); fD = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; E = Iddināya (= Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu, husband of fD)

elementText.text:
Promissory note (imittu) of dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 12 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the fie[ld in  Kār-Nabû]­-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šul[lim]. They are to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru), in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI. For each 1 kor of dates, a load of palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku) are to be delivered. They bear responsibility for each other and whoever will be at hand is to pay. The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 3 witnesses, including the uncle of fA (Silim-Bābu/Ibnāya//Egibi), and the scribe (Bēl-ittanu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Kutimmu).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu

elementText.text:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA 6 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the harvest of fA’s field in Kār-Tašmētu. He is to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru) in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI, together with 1 kor loa[ds of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu)], date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku). At least 4 witnesses, and the scribe(?) (Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Dābibī) – although without such designation.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal

elementText.text:
guard’s fee (kādu) and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu), 15 loads of palm frond ribs (huṣābu) and 17 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu) out of 17 kor of dates from the yield of the plot (ebūr eqli) that C owes to fB. On instructions of fB he receives it from D on behalf of C. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ahhē-iqīša/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi). Addendum: his šissinnu has not been paid.
 
A = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; fB = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi, wife of Iddin-Nabû; C = Balāṭu/Nabû-bālti-ilī (gardener [nukaribbu] of fB); D = Šamaš-iddin/Nabû-zēru-iqīša//Balāṭu

They are to renew (šanû) the roof (ūru) and repair the drain (asurrû). They also must not interrupt the bread deliveries (baṭlu ša akali). 2 witnesses legible, remainder of rev. lost.
 
fA = [...]//Aqara

elementText.text:
Division of a house: B inherits from A2 part of the jointly inherited house of 12 sq. of A1 and A2, after the latter had passed away (šīmtu abālu, u-bil-lu). In the 6th year of Cyrus B and A1 divide the house, with the following shares of B: 16 cubits 4 fingers on the upper side on the west, next to the house of A1, 16 cubits 4 fingers on the [lo]wer [side] on the east, next to the narrow through-street (sūqu qatnu āṣû), 15 cubits 6 fingers on the upper front on the north [next to the ex]it (mūṣû) of B2, 15 cubits 6 fingers on the [lower front] on the south, next to the house of D1 and next to plot [of the dowry of (nudunnû)] of fD2; i.e. a total of 5 square reeds 10 square fingers (ca. 62 m²). The rest, as little or much there is, together with the exit-way belong to A1. Addendum: A1 has no outstanding credits against A2 or C, so the agreement is not to be altered (enû). Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-zēru-iqīša/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê).
 
A1 = Balāṭu/Kurbanni-Marduk//Rab-banê; A2 = Gimillu/Kurbanni-Marduk/Rab-banê (brother of A1); B = Bēl-rēmanni/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; C = Etellu (his relation to r A2 is not further specified) D1 = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Nabû-zēru-ušabši//Atû; fD2 = fLū-idiya/Marduk-ušallim//Egibi

elementText.text:
Dispute over purchase of butcher’s prebend: B raises a claim on the butcher’s prebend before Išhara that C bought from A2 (cf. BM77478+) and regarding which fA1 drew up a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy (cf. BM77521). fA1 pays B 1 mina of white silver to settle the dispute. A clause against further litigation follows, including the return of the 1 mina of silver to fA1 and this tablet to B in case of further claims. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-iqīša/Šumu-iddin//Lēˀêa).
 
fA1 = Kabtāya/Damqia; A2 = Ana-Bēl-ēreš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk; B = Bēl-iddin/Nergal-ušēzib//Ileˀˀi-Marduk; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for remainder of the price of a prebend: B owes to A 15 shekels of white silver of 1/8 alloy, which is the remainder of the price of a prebend of A. In Nisannu (I) B is to pay up. Apart from the 15 shekels he is to also pay 4 shekels of silver to C. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-rēmanni//Rab-banê).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Šamaš-pirˀ-uṣur//Eppēš-ilī; C = Gula-zēru-ibni.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with prebend as security: B1 and fB2 owe 5/6 mina of silver of 1/8 alloy to A. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina (20 %). They pledge the prebend of Kāribu of the gate of the shrine of Marduk as security. No one else has right of disposal (šalāṭu) over the prebend as long as the debt towards A stands. B1 and fB2 vouch for each other. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Bānûnu/Nabû-ēṭir//Rab-banê). Addendum: Previous promissory notes (scil. DCEPHE435 and VAT97) of A against B1 are invalid (hepû, huppû).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin//Nappāhu; fB2 = fMaqartu/Nabû-ēṭir//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Rescinding of gift of slave: fA took pity (rēmu rašû) on her sons and returns (turru) C. Before, fA had promised C to fB1 along with 0.3.2 kor of planted land in Nabātu (cf. VAT109). Now neither fB1 nor fB2 will have the right of disposal (šalāṭu) over C. But they still have the right to the 1 kor of land of fA. 2 ina ašabi-witnesses, fB1 and fB2, 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Ea-pattannu). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; fB1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB); fB2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB);  C = Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu (cf. VAT109)

A = Dihummu/Handašānu//Ileˀˀi-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 1 mina 8 shekels of white unstamped cut silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears monthly interest of 1 shekel of silver per mina starting on the 1st of [...]. The clause when the debt is to be paid is not legible. 7 witnesses and the scribe (Uballissu-Marduk/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Ēṭiru).
 
A = Šellebu/Bazūzu//Bābūtu; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver (ilku): On the 15th day fB is to pay to A 12 shekels of cut silver of 1/8 alloy as the service obligation (ilku) of D till the end of Tašrītu (VII) (?) of the 11thyear of Darius, for the payment of which C guarantees. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Šangû-parakki).

A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = fTabluṭu/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu; C = Hambāqu/Ina-Bēl-ultarrah; D = Libluṭ/Iqīšāya//Bābūtu (brother of fB)

elementText.text:
Purchase of a slave: fB sold fC and her month-old son to fA for 1 mina 12 shekels of silver. A clause follows concerning D1’s and D2’s responsibility for fC2, in the case of lawsuits (pūt sihî), vindication (pūt pāqirāni) and claims for the status of a royal slave (amat šarrūti) and freedom (mār banûti). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk/Balāssu//Bēl-eṭēri). Addendum: fB has received payment.
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fB = Nūptāya/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu; fC = fNanāya-bēl-uṣrī; D1 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Šulāya/Rab-banê (son of fB); D2 = Pirˀu/Nāˀid-Marduk//Bābūtu (brother of fB)

A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Šumu-ukīn(?)/Taqīš-Gula; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Tēšî-ēṭir

elementText.text:
Promissory note (imittu) of dates: B1 and B2 owe to fA 12 kor of dates, impost (imittu) of the fie[ld in  Kār-Nabû]­-ša-ina-muhhi-nāri-ša-Ahhē-šul[lim]. They are to pay it all in Arahsamnu (VIII) in the storehouse (haṣāru), in the mašīhu-measure of 1 PI. For each 1 kor of dates, a load of palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu), date baskets (gipû), date-palm fibres (mangagu), a load of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 1 container of pressed dates (darīku) are to be delivered. They bear responsibility for each other and whoever will be at hand is to pay. The šissinnu and the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) are not paid. 3 witnesses, including the uncle of fA (Silim-Bābu/Ibnāya//Egibi), and the scribe (Bēl-ittanu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Kutimmu).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Niqūdu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Pahāru; B2 = Mukīn-zēri/Hambaqu//Mutakkilu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with house as antichretic pledge: B1, B2 and B3 owe to fA 1 1/3 min of cut silver of 1/8 alloy. Their house next to those of C1 and C2 is antichretically pledged as security to fA for two years. After they pay her she will relinquish the house. In the meantime she is to have the drain (asurrû) repaired (batqa ṣabātu) and roof (ūru) renewed (šanû). The house is at fA’s disposal from the 17th of Arahsamnu (VIII). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-ēṭir//Šangû-Ninurta).
 
fA = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B2 and B3); B2 = Nidintu/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B1 and B3); B3 = Erībāya/Bēl-iddin//Irˀanni (brother of B1 and B2); C1 = Balāṭu; C2 = Munahhiš-Marduk/Nabû-kāṣir//Asû

A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu

elementText.text: Administrative list concerning disbursements from the temple of Išhara: 20 kor of barley for bread and beer, 32 kor of barley for oxen, 19 kor of barley for sheep, 9.2.3 kor of barley for lambs, 6.1.4 kor of barley for birds are listed. A total of 84.4.1 kor of barley of the temple of Išhara is given, although the total should be 86.4.1. (Rev. uninscribed).

elementText.text:
Concerning payment of price of butcher’s prebend: B2 assumes half a share of the payment of 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy, the price for the prebend before Išhara, that fA charged against B1 (cf. BM77521 and BM77478+).  5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-ittannu/Arad-Bēl//Šarru-teṣlītu).
 
fA = Kabtāya/Damqiya; B1 = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B2 = [?]/Nergal-ušallim//Qaqqadānītu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with prebendary income as security: B owes 10 shekels of silver of 1/8 alloy to A. A takes B’s prebendary bowls (malâtu) of 0;0.0.2 kor in total before the golden vats (dannūt hurāṣi) in Esagil as security until he receives (šalāmu) his 10 shekels. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina (20%). 3 witnesses and the scribe (Esagil-mukīn-apli/Balāṭu//Egibi, brother-in-law of A). 
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Division of inheritance consisting of prebends: A1 and A2 divide temple enterer’s (ērib bīti) prebends. The income consists of 0;0.0.4 of bread, 0;0.0.4 of fine beer and the sheep of the eclipses before Sîn of Egišnugal. The share of A1 is 5/6 of the prebend before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk and the vats of fine beer before Zāriqu. The share of A2 is 3 qa of bread, 3 qa of fine beer before Išhara and 1/6 of the prebend before Kāribu of the shrine of Marduk.The one who performs the office of priest (šangû) shall enjoy the income(?)of his prebend (pānāt isqu). They also shall observe the kinayyātu-offerings of their father according to their share. 5 witnesses and the scribe (Esagil-šumu-ukīn/Iqīšāya/Ēṭiru). Addendum: each party has taken a copy so that the agreement would not be altered
 
A1 = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; A2 = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu

elementText.text:

A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; fB = Amat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Adoption agreement with bequest of promissory notes: B transfers (dagālu) a total of 3 ½ minas 5 shekels of silver in promissory notes, the credit of B in circulation (ina sūqi), to his adoptive son A. After one year A will give (nadānu) 2 kor of barley, 4 vats of fine beer and 1 gulīnu-garment to B (in fulfilment of his duty) as a son (ša mārūti). B is to hand over to A the promissory notes for the 3 ½ minas 5 shekels of silver. B will enjoy the interest on the silver in his lifetime. The promissory notes are the following:
1 mina 10 shekels of silver owed by C1, for which B took (ṣabātu) his house as security, in which B lives;
50 shekels of silver owed by C2;
1/3 mina of silver owed by C3;
15 shekels of silver owed by C4;
15 shekels of silver owed by C5;
10 shekels of silver owed by C6;
½ mina 5 shekels of silver owed by C7, which was drawn up (eˀēlu) in the name of fC8.
4 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Bēl-ušallim//Sîn-tabni). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; C1 = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Dādia/Rab-banê (cf. VAT51 for filiation); C2 = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; C3 = Lâbâši; C4 = Kalbāya, the weaver; C5 = Nabû-ušallim; C6 = Iddin-Nabû, the Borsippean(?); C7 = Nabû-šumu-iddin; fC8 = fTappaššar (wife of B; cf. Baker 2004, 32f.)

elementText.text:
Lease of boat: B leases to A the boat that is at his disposal for captaincy (malāhūtu) from C for a daily rent of 1 shekel of silver, beginning on the 28th day (of Arahsamnu [VIII]). Each party has taken a copy. 3 witnesses, including the cousin of A (Nabû-kuṣuršu/Nādin//Gahal), and the scribe (Nidintu-Marduk//Rab-banê) (brother-in-law of A).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Nergal-iddin/Ardia; C = Nabû-uṣuršu

The tablet further states that from Simānu (III) of the 28th year the capital will increase monthly (ina arhi qaqqadu ir[ab]bi). 6 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-iddin/[...]//[S]în-šad[ûnu])
 
A = Kuṣurāya/Šaddinnu//Eppeš-ilī; B = Nergal-uballiṭ/Arad-Gula//Irˀanni; C = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Obligation to produce receipts: B swears to A by Bēl, Nabû and Darius, the king, that he will bring the receipts (giṭṭu) to show them to A by the 2nd Tašrītu (VII). If he does not he is to pay the silver according to his promissory note (uˀiltu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu//Rab-banê).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin[//Arad-Nergal]

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver: B owes A 5 shekels of silver of 1/8 alloy. The debt bears yearly interest of 12 shekels of silver per mina. A clause excluding a previous promissory note (uˀiltu) for 10 shekels of silver follows. 2 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-nāṣir/Esagil-šadûnu//Sîn-tabni-uṣur).
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nādin/Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver (ilku): A receives from B 1/3 mina 8 shekels of white silver as the service obligation (ilku) of C1 and C2 till the end of Ayyāru (II) of the 19th year. 3 witnesses and the scribe (Nabû-udammiq//Egibi). Addendum: Each party has taken a copy.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B = Arad-Bēl/Gūzānu//Tunāya; C1 = Gūzānu/Bēl-useppe//Bābūtu; C2 = Šulum-ana-Bābili/Bēl-useppe//Bābūtu (brother of C1)

elementText.text:
Revocation of the purchase of a slave: The chief judge (sartennu) and the judges (dajānu) revoke the purchase of C by A from B for 2 minas 15 shekels of silver. After the purchase the slave was given to the house of a Persian (ša bīt parsāyi) of the household of D, who sent him back (to B?). A receives the 2 minas 15 shekels of silver and its interest and he returns the pertaining documents (uˀiltu) to B. 4 witnesses and the scribe (Marduk-šumu-ibni/Bēl-aplu-iddin//Egibi).
 
A = Habaṣīru/Tabnêa; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; C = Nabû-ittannu; D = Marduk-šāpik-zēri

elementText.text:
Promissory note (imittu) for dates: B owes to fA1 and fA2 5 kor of dates, impost (imittu) on the harvest of their field. He is to pay in Arahsamnu (VIII) together with 10 loads of palm-frond ribs (huṣābu) and 10 palm-leaf baskets (tuhallu). 2 witnesses and the scribe (Iddin-Bēl//Burāqu). Addendum: the levy of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu) [is] un[pa]id.
 
fA1 = fEsagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi; fA2 = fGigītu/Balāṭu//Egibi (sister of fA1); B = Iddin-Nabû/Zababa-iddin//Arad-Nergal

elementText.text:
Promissory note with house as security: B1 owes to A 2/3 mina of cut silver of 1/8 alloy by Tašrītu (VII). B1’s house in Babylon next to those of C1 and C2 is the security for A. 6 witnesses and the scribe (Ṭāb-ṣilli-Marduk/Rab-banê). Addendum: the sum includes the credit of B2.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Atkuppu; B2 = Nabû-bēl-šumāti//Atkuppu (father of B1); C1 = Līširu/Bazūzu//Bēl-ušumgal; C2 = Bazūzu/[...]//[...]

elementText.text:
Purchase of house: A purchases from B1, B2 and B3 a house of 5 sq. r (c. 61,25 m²) outside the Zababa Gate in the district of Babylon. The house is situated on the upper west side next to the through-street (sūqu āṣû), on the lower west side next to the house of C1, on the upper northern front next to the house of C2, and on the lower southern front next to the house of C3. The agreed price is 13 ½ shekels of silver per sq. r, so A pays 1 mina 7 ½ shekels of silver and additional 2 ½ shekels for the clothing of the mistress of the house (lubāru ša bēlet bīti). B1, B2 and B3 receive 1 mina and 10 shekels of block silver in total. The document closes with the usual final clauses regarding the reception of the money, exclusion of further litigation on part of the seller’s party on pain of paying the price 12 times over and a further clause concerning settlement of excess or lack of sq. r according to the agreed price. 5 witnesses (ina kanāk ṭuppi), including the uncle of B1-3 (Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu), who took 3 shekels of silver as his gift (qištu), and the scribe (Nabû-ušallim//Miṣirāya). Fingernail impressions of B1, B2 and B3 have been placed instead of seals.
 
A = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu; B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; B2 = Iqīša-Marduk/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; B3 = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Nappāhu; C1 = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ēṭir//Rēmut-ilī; C2 = Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Ša,-Nabû-šū//Pahāru; C3 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Mušallim-Marduk//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Administrative list concerning the king’s income from prebendary service of the cultic year (partly damaged): 7 ruled sections list (mainly) meat offerings of the royal rations (kurummat šarri) before Išhara throughout the whole year:
1) from 5 baskets (pišannu), of beef there are 5 thighs (pēmu), 5 loin cuts (zibbatu), 5 humps (asqubbītu), 10 short rib cuts (ṣēlu karû), 20 ankle cuts (kursinnu), the fat from between the intestines (lipû ša birit irrī); and of mutton 5 loin cuts, 5 rump cuts (arkatu), 5 fatty tissues, 5 loin cuts of lamb;
2) from the basket of [day x+]1, of beef there are 1 thigh, 1 loin cut, 1 hump, 2(?) short rib cuts, 4 ankle cuts; and of mutton 1 loin cut, [1 rum]p cut, 1 fatty tissue, 1 loin cut of lamb;
3) from the 2 greeting of the temple (šalām bīti) rituals of the 8th of Tašrītu (VII) and the 5th of Kislīmu (IX), of beef there are 2 thighs, 2 [loi]n cuts, 2 humps, [4 sho]rt [rib cuts], 8 ank[le cuts]; and of [mutton] 2 loi[n cuts, 2 rump cuts], 2 fatty tiss[ues, 2 loin cuts] of lamb;
4) the 25th of Ayyāru (II), 4th and 13th day [...], the 11th of Ṭebētu (X), of mutton there are 10 loin cuts, 10 rump cuts, 10 [fatty tissues];
5) [...] of mutton there are 1 loin cut, 1 rump cut, 1 fatty tissue, 1 loin [cut of lamb];
6) from the sa[tukku(?) ...] 5 eššēšu-festivals and 10 bayyatānu-festivals the time periods in Simānu (III) between the 25th and 29th (a total of 5 days) and in Kislīmu (IX) the 11th day [...], and in Ṭebētu (X) the 21st and the 13th(?) day are mentioned;
7) the 21st of Ṭebētu (X) [among others...] is mentioned in connection with 1 pomegranate (nur[mû]) [...].

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, price of a butcher’s prebend: fA draws up (eˀēlu) against B a promissory note (uˀiltu) over 3 minas of white cut silver of 1/8 alloy. This silver is the price of her butcher’s prebend in Ešasurra, the temple of Išhara, which C had sold to B for said price in an earlier tablet (scil. BM77478+).  Should a dispute (ragāmu) or claim (paqāru) arise over the prebend fA is to return this promissory note and B is to return the purchase tablet of the prebend. 9 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-bullissu/Nabû-aplu-iddin//Saggilāya).
 
fA = Kabtāya/Damqia; B = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû//Nappāhu; C = Ana-Bēl-ereš/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ileˀˀi-Marduk

elementText.text:
Record of dispute conducted before citizens (mār banê): A and B dispute over the prebend before Bēl-āliya-ša-Šarrabānu. B was not granted rights (šuršû) over the prebend. B says that his prebend is at the disposal of A, so A should give him the 10 shekels of silver that B had paid on his behalf to C. A list of 5 witnesses follows; no scribe. Rubrum: It is a notice (tahsistu) so as to not forget.
 
A = Šākin-šumi/Nadnāya//Nappāhu; B = Balāṭu/Marduk-erība//Nappāhu; C = Zūzāya

elementText.text:
Agreement regarding the payment of rations: B will give (nadānu) one jar (šapû) monthly to fA1 out of the rations (kurrummatu) from the 1st day of Tašrītu (VII) that fA1 and A2 agreed upon (magāru). Those rations comprise 3 kor of barley, [x] amount of dates, 5 minas of wool, ½ talent of salt, [x] amount of cress(?) (sahlû), 0;0.3 kor of sesame, 2 shekels of silver. Since A2 made over his assets to him, fTašmētu-rēmīnni will serve fA1 and A2 as compensation, for as long A2 enters into the presence (erēbu, ana pāni erēbu) of fA1. fA1 assumes liability (mahāṣu, pūtu mahāṣu) for A2 and retains the usufruct of her dowry. 7 witnesses, including the brother of fA1 (Bēl-usātu/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn), and the scribe (Iqīša-Marduk//Bēl-eṭēri). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA1 = fTappaššar/Niqūdu=Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Gimillu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Nappāhu; B = Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Statement at court concerning a dispute over an unpaid debt: B owes 50 shekels of cut silver to A. The debt will bear a monthly interest of 1 shekel per mina. Concerning this debt note (uˀiltu) A states that C1 drew it up (eˀēlu) in the name of fC2 against (ina muhhi) B and that fC2 confirmes (kânu) this. (Rest of statement is lost) 2 witnesses, a judge (Bēl-supê-muhur//[-]) and an uppadētu-official (Nabû-nādin-ahi//Ēṭiru), and the scribe (Mušēzib-Bēl//Egibi).
 
A = Šellebu/Iddin-Nabû/Nappāhu; B = Rēmūtu/Nabû-šumu-līšir/Bēl-aplu-uṣur; C1 = Iddin-Nabû (Iddināya)/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu (father of A); fC2 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu (mother of A)

elementText.text:
Rescinding of gift of slave: fA took pity (rēmu rašû) on her sons and returns (turru) C. Before, fA had promised C to fB1 along with 0.3.2 kor of planted land in Nabātu (cf. VAT109). Now neither fB1 nor fB2 will have the right of disposal (šalāṭu) over C. But they still have the right to the 1 kor of land of fA. 2 ina ašabi-witnesses, fB1 and fB2, 5 witnesses and the scribe (Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Ea-pattannu). Addendum: each party has taken a copy.
 
fA = fKaššāya/Šumu-iddin//Kutimmu; fB1 = fIna-Esagil-ramât/Balāṭu//Egibi (elder daughter of fB); fB2 = fAmat-Ninlil/Balāṭu//Egibi (younger daughter of fB);  C = Bēl-silim/fŠeleppūtu (cf. VAT109)
